verbs.description: phantomize (third-person singular simple present phantomizes, present participle phantomizing, simple past and past participle phantomized)

entries.meaning: (transitive, dated, derogatory) To make phantom-like or spiritual, or transport into a ghostly realm.
examples: Do not phantomize the Redeemer when you want him in very deed.

entries.meaning: (transitive, sciences) To remove (a goal in a model) from consideration by ensuring it is achieved in advance.
